intro: Anneslia comosa, commonly known as the woolly anneslia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth habit. The plant features dense clusters of small, white to pale purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically covered in fine, woolly hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Anneslia comosa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and delicate blooms.
